1.) A single report is all it takes for a game to be reviewed. It doesn't matter if you were reported once or 9 times. A premade would have no impact on the review of your case.

2.) You were not banned. You were chat restricted.

3.) You got another chat restriction just 5 days prior to this. You should know that constantly arguing with teammates will lead to a penalty. Mute them, and move on.

1. 10 game chat restrict
2. 25 game chat restrict
3. 14- day

So yea, arguing w/ teammates can get you permabanned.

Also, I'd rather not just type at all, trying to fill roles, go here, or there and your teams mad, then flamed, then you say anything back and its all on you (or even if you simply have a bad game, or make a bad play)

can you be punished for not typing, will a receive a 2 week ban if i say nothing at all, because if one disagreement leads to it then, id rather not say anything

No, you cannot be punished for not typing at all.  The system allows you to communicate with pings, so there is actually no need to type in game.  And you are free to /mute your team if you are worried about being provoked by anything they might say.  

[Source](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/unobngtr-how-player-behavior-penalties-affect-hextech-crafting?comment=00000000000000010001000200000000000000000001)

Number of reports has zero effect, all they do is trigger a review of the game. Context and self-defense are completely ignored by the system, and rightly so. It judges from a third-party perspective.

Eventually, it is possible that you would get a chat restriction if you make a habit of this.  Don't pick fights and argue.  The purpose of chat is to coordinate with teammates, and if you abuse the chat system to argue with people, other people are going to get sick of it and report you both.

If you don't like what is happening, ignore them.  If you lack the self-control to ignore them, mute them.  If they are harassing you chanting "report him" all game, mute them and report them if you wish.  Persisting in arguments can only serve to hurt you.

Account level, matchmaking things, etc.  The important thing to understand is that matchmaking seeks to match teams so that both have a fair shot at winning and the number of games played does not actually reflect an individual's capability to win games.  One person may play at a level far higher than people with many times that number of games.

The good news for you is that when you reach Level 30, matchmaking should improve significantly for you over the near 30 games.

Side-note:  I would also suggest changing your name.

Hmm, well, I would say you are a little passive-aggressive at times, and you are engaging in bickering and arguing with your teams, but the chat logs seem relatively mild.  The thing is though... the way the Instant Feedback System works, it doesn't ask "Does this chat warrant a ban?"  It asks "Does this chat warrant a punishment?"  If the answer is yes, then the player is issued with the next punishment in the punishment tier list.  There are four of them.

1.  10 game chat restriction
2. 25 game chat restriction
3. 14 day temporary suspension
4. permanent suspension

So, if a player has had no prior punishments, but they get reported enough times that the system decides they deserve punishment, they will be issued the first punishment.  If they are already at one of the other tiers, then they will move up to the next higher tier, which means even relatively mild logs can result in a permanent suspension, if a player has shown to be consistently toxic.  (Note, if a player is extremely toxic, they can skip tiers and be escalated directly to one of the suspensions.)

Now, one final thing to point out.  The report system is actually set up so that premade groups cannot abuse it.  Even if all 4 of them reported you in each of the 3 matches, it doesn't count the same as having 12 reports from 12 different matches.  While their reports would have flagged the matches for review by the system, if the system did not find anything inappropriate in them, the reports would be found invalid, and no punishment would be issued.
